page.title: 10Bramdean Village Amenities
page.content: The village has a 12th century church which has services every Sunday. The services of the rector are shared with 2 small neighbouring parishes, Hinton Ampner and Kilmeston. The village has a post office,which is an important service to the population; it is combined with a shop. The village hall was built by the community for the community. It is run as a charity; with rents for use and various fund raising events held each year, providing income for the upkeep. Bramdean has a children's playground bought by the residue of public subscriptions raised to celebrate H.M. Queen Elizabeth 2nd's Silver Jubilee. There is a bus shelter on the A272, and the travelling library visits every 2 weeks.
